about.name: Yatharth Mogra
description: I’m a computer science graduate student with a background in building real systems. I’ve worked as a software developer, competed in hackathons, and spend an unhealthy amount of time turning vague ideas into working products. I care about clean abstractions, strong fundamentals, and shipping things that actually get used. Lately, I’m focused on machine learning systems, reasoning models, and building tools that reduce human busywork.

Right now, I work as a research assistant at NYU Langone Health, where I am building deep learning pipelines to predict time to total knee replacement. The work sits at the intersection of healthcare and ML, with a focus on translating data into clinically meaningful signals.

I graduated from IIT Mandi and worked as a software development engineer at Walmart, building production systems at scale. Alongside that, I’ve consistently explored ideas through hackathons and side projects, which shaped how I think about speed, constraints, and practical problem-solving.

updates.description: Completed 2nd out of 220 Teams in AWS Financial Hackathon 2025.
Won Best Cloudflare Implementation Award in Nasa Space Apps Challenge 2025.
Joined MS in CS @ NYU, in the city of New York!

2026.name: Google Tunix Hack: Teach a LLM to reason using tunix
2026.description: Most open-source or open-weight language models can give you an answer. But they typically don’t ‘show their work’ - the steps they went through to arrive at that conclusion in a consistent manner. Here, we use Tunix, Google’s new JAX-native library for LLM post-training, to train a model to show its work by laying out a reasoning trace before landing on an answer.

2025.name: DocuFlow: Auditing Intelligence Layer
2025.description: An AI Agent that monitors business contracts and vendor payments, automatically detecting overcharges, hidden fee increases, and unfavorable renewals. It alerts companies before money is lost and helps them take action to correct billing issues.
2025.techStack: Landing AI ADE, Gemini, AWS, Python, React

2025.name: Astro-RAG: AI-Powered Document Retrieval
2025.description: A comprehensive Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) system built on Cloudflare Workers that processes PDF documents and provides intelligent query responses using AI. This project won first place at the NASA NYC Hackathon, demonstrating advanced AI capabilities for document processing and intelligent querying.
2025.techStack: Gemini, Cloudflare, NASA Open Science Data Repository, Javascript, React

2024.name: RSNA 2024 Lumbar Spine Degenerative Classification
2024.description: What the project is and why it exists. This addresses a specific problem in the real world. I built this to solve X because Y was insufficient. The core challenge was Z, which I approached by doing A, B, and C.
2024.techStack: Pytorch, 3DResNet18, UNet, MultiModal Attention based Fusion

sections.title: General Information
content: Email: yatharthmogra at gmail dot com

content.description: Focusing on foundational Reinforcement Learning and LLM finetuning.

content.degree: Bachelor of Technology, Data Science and Engineering
content.description: Studied Computer Science with focus on Deep Learning and Computer Vision

content.title: Software Engineer
content.description: Led multiple **mobile engineering and analytics initiatives**, including building an **app analytics framework** to inform product decisions, optimizing **telemetry and logging** to cut costs, and **modularizing large-scale mobile apps** for efficient development. Also contributed to a **cross-platform quality inspection app** enabling real-time operational feedback.

content.title: Data Engineer
details: Built **end-to-end AWS data pipelines**, orchestrating **ETL workflows** with **Glue and Lambda** to securely process and store data for **2,000+ users** across **30+ applications** in S3.
Architected scalable infrastructure integrating multi-source personal data to deliver actionable insights for client-facing analytics.

content.title: Research Assistant
details: Developed an **end-to-end multimodal deep learning pipeline** for time-to-total knee replacement prediction, integrating 3D knee MRI with tabular clinical data across **3,000+ patients**.
Modeled as survival analysis using **DAFT-based conditioning** and **multimodal attention**, achieving C-index up to 0.85 and **65–67% risk stratification accuracy**.

sections.title: Technical Skills
content: **DevTools:** Git, Bash, Powershell, Docker, Postman, Linux, Anaconda, Google Cloud App Engine(GCP).
**Libraries/Frameworks:** Flask, OpenCV, Tensorflow, PyTorch, OpenAI Gym, Numpy, Pandas.

content.title: AWS Financial Hackathon 2025
content.description: Created DocuFlow, an auditing intelligence layer using Gemini, Landing AI ADE, and AWS services to convert financial documents into actionable insights and automatically flag invoice–contract mismatches.

content.title: NASA Space Apps Challenge 2025
content.description: Built a CF Workers–based RAG system for fast PDF ingestion and AI-driven querying, delivering millisecond retrieval and winning first place at NASA NYC.

sections.title: Interests
content: Tech Pragmatist, Bon Vivant, Cinephile, Strength-first Training
